page.title: 20MAY DAY AT MITCHELDEAN
page.content:
The recent introduction of the May Day Bank Holiday has led to a revival of traditional customs. The Forest of Dean Morris Men dance at dawn on the summit of May Hill, a well known local viewpoint. In 1985 they also danced in Mitcheldean Church, as part of a special service, and afterwards in the churchyard as part of a May Day Fair, with stallholders in traditional dress of long skirts, aprons, blouses, shawls and mop caps. There was a Maypole with coloured ribbons, and girls handed out flowers from baskets.
DOMESDAY SURVEY FOR THE MITCHELDEAN AREA WAS COMPILED BY MITCHELDEAN PRIMARY SCHOOL. PROJECT CO-ORDINATOR, EDITOR, and PHOTOGRAPHER WAS MR. H.J.HAWKINGS. THE WORK WAS BEGUN IN MAY AND COMPLETED IN JULY. 1985
